SEARCH
Package org.opensearch.sdk

Class SDKClient.SDKRestClient

java.lang.Object
org.opensearch.sdk.SDKClient.SDKRestClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
Enclosing class:
SDKClient
@Deprecated public static class SDKClient.SDKRestClient extends Object implements Closeable
Deprecated.
Use OpenSearchClient.
Wraps an internal RestHighLevelClient using method signatures expected by Client and AdminClient syntax, providing a drop-in replacement in existing plugins with a minimum of code changes.

While some Client interface methods are implemented here, the interface is intentionally not fully implemented as it is intended to be deprecated.

Do not use this client for new development.

See Also:
  • OpenSearch Issue 5424

    Instantiate this class wrapping a RestHighLevelClient.

      Deprecated.
      Sends a request to the OpenSearch cluster that the client points to.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the response returned by OpenSearch
      Throws:

    • performRequestAsync

      public org.opensearch.client.Cancellable performRequestAsync(org.opensearch.client.Request request, org.opensearch.client.ResponseListener responseListener)
      Deprecated.
      Sends a request to the OpenSearch cluster that the client points to. The request is executed asynchronously and the provided ResponseListener gets notified upon request completion or failure. Selects a host out of the provided ones in a round-robin fashion. Failing hosts are marked dead and retried after a certain amount of time (minimum 1 minute, maximum 30 minutes), depending on how many times they previously failed (the more failures, the later they will be retried). In case of failures all of the alive nodes (or dead nodes that deserve a retry) are retried until one responds or none of them does, in which case an IOException will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      request - the request to perform
      responseListener - the ResponseListener to notify when the request is completed or fails
      Returns:
      Cancellable instance that may be used to cancel the request

    • close
